events.description: Release of trade data for December 2025 showing the widening of the trade deficit to EUR 3.6 billion.

facts.fact_text: The trade deficit in Greece widened to EUR 3.6 billion in December 2025 from EUR 3.5 billion in December 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: The trade deficit in Greece widened slightly to EUR 3.6 billion in December 2025 from a revised EUR 3.5 billion in the same month a year ago.

facts.fact_text: Imports grew by 1.5% year-on-year to EUR 7.7 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Imports grew by 1.5% year-on-year to EUR 7.7 billion

facts.fact_text: Exports increased by 0.7% to EUR 4.1 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, exports increased by 0.7% to EUR 4.1 billion

facts.fact_text: The annual trade gap for 2025 narrowed to EUR 33.5 billion from EUR 35.6 billion in 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: For the whole year of 2025, the country's trade gap narrowed to EUR 33.5 billion from EUR 35.6 billion in 2024

claims.claim_text: The trade gap reached its largest level since November 2022 because imports rose more than exports.

evidences.evidence_text: This was the largest trade gap since November 2022, as imports rose more than exports.

evidence.evidence_text: Imports grew by 1.5% year-on-year to EUR 7.7 billion, driven mainly by increased purchases from the EU (9.1%)
Meanwhile, exports increased by 0.7% to EUR 4.1 billion due to higher sales to the EU (11.8%)
The trade deficit in Greece widened slightly to EUR 3.6 billion in December 2025
